With the shipment of horses to Captain Zeferino, just now, at three in the afternoon, I can dispatch José. Through him, I am sending a arroba of grass, and in the first cart that becomes available for that, I will send more.

The medicine for Epaminondas is also included, to whom you should apply continuous baths of marshmallow, milk, and water, and you will avoid all heavy food and drink, so he does not cry to avoid provoking the blood. As for Aristides, you should do the same as already recommended; I hope there will be nothing serious, God willing. No remedies are being sent for Mariana's son because you did not mention the symptoms of the illness; in the end, only a load of patience can help us.

The projected invasion on this point has evaporated, thanks to Providence; however, I remain vigilant, and you need not have the slightest concern for my safety. The troops from Rio Pardo have not arrived yet; the President likewise, and I am desperate to free myself from the mental discomfort that has been bothering me quite a bit, to the point that I anxiously wish to see myself in any corner of the Eastern State, although it is also risky, as I am running out of patience.
